summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Fifteenth Avenue Northeast, from East Fortieth Street to Brintnal Place, and Brintnal Place, on the north side of the Northern Pacific Railroad Company's right of way, from Fifteenth Avenue Northeast to Fourteenth Avenue Northeast, all in the City of Seattle, by grading and curbing the same, and by constructing concrete walks and wooden cross walks, together with catch basins and other necessary appurtenances, in accordance with Resolution No. 1286 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
